detailsOfAchievement: Centre for Social Responsibility (CSRL) is a Delhi based NGO registered under Societies Registration Act of 1860 in the year 2008. CSRL works in the field of education, skill development, drug de-addiction, and advocacy. It runs 19 Super 30 centres all over India where free 11 months residential coaching cum mentoring cum counselling for JEE and NEET entrance exams are provided to poor but meritorious students.

detailsOfAchievement: CEQUINs strength comes from its strategic approach based on the following principles Work in new emerging areas with diverse stakeholders and innovative methods Synergize civil society efforts with that of the government of the day for higher impact Work towards sustainable solutions Transcend welfare mode of charity and doles to that of social enterprise and entitlements Create a feminist approach that looks for active partnership with men Connect global to local Our successful projects include Jamia Womens Empowerment Project CEQUIN runs a Gender Resource Centre GRC in Jamia Nagar New Delhi which is inhabited by migrant Muslim communities living in urban poverty The GRC is one of CEQUINs most successful initiatives. The partnership with the Delhi Government has enabled us to have a huge outreach nearly 10000 households The multiple project components helps us provide a 360 degrees holistic approach to womens empowerment addressing education livelihoods health and nutrition water and sanitation legal aid and counseling formation of collectives access to schemes etc Sports for Leadership Project CEQUIN has been running an innovative project using sports as a tool for leadership building In 2011 CEQUIN decided to test out some of the long term goals of the Committee and run a pilot program in Jamia Nagar This was a fine example to putting high table advocacy to practice at the ground level In recognition of our work Sara Pilot Chairperson CEQUIN has been appointed Chairperson of the Womens Committee AIFF Ambitious targets have been set for the national team as well as for grassroots participation Violence Against Women Campaign This project has been rolled out in 4 phases Stage1 was conducting a first of its kind study entitled Perception and Experience of Gendered Violations in Public Places of Delhi in 2009 Stage2 was a high profile campaign with Delhi Daredevils Cricketer Virender Sehwag spread the message of redefining masculinity and respecting women Stage3 took the discourse beyond sexual harassment to look at a range of violations women are subjected to in public spaces Stage4 was the roll out of grassroots interventions through local collectives stakeholder groups and mass events Also CEQUIN has been working closely with the police as well as several schools for gender sensitization CEQUIN was the first organization to create focus on violence in public spaces at a time when the entire discourse was focused on domestic violence and sexual harassment at work place We realized the need to build advocacy on the issues of public spaces The CEQUIN study of 2009 received massive media coverage and was referred to in a question in parliament The National conference brought in the law minster NCW Chairperson UN Resident Representative and high level government officials and sensitized them on the issue We can take some credit for the subsequent openness of the government police and other stakeholders to the issue

detailsOfAchievement: Chetana works under five verticals: 1. Education Udaan-Free tuition classes : 500+ students have received the benefits from these classes. Teach India : 500+ students have received the benefits from these classes. The programme aims to give learners the confidence to use English in contexts such as retail, customer service, travel and hospitality, financial services and job interviews. Around 20 students were empowered. Surr Chetana : Surr-Chetana, is one of the projects of Chetana Conscience of Women.It began with instrumental training of students like Tabla & Harmonium.More than 75 students received training from this course. Summer Camp-Masti Ki Pathshala : The summer camp that Chetana conducts witnesses the sharing and learning of a plethora of constructive skills and activities and has managed to reach 500+ children. 2.Safety Saftey Awareness and Self Defense Classes : Chetana conducts Safety Awareness Workshops and Self-Defence Classes in schools, colleges, coaching institutes and Resident Welfare Associations all over Delhi and NCR.The basic aim is to make women aware about their surroundings, make them more vigilant and spontaneous to any dangers. With an overwhelming response from the participants.Chetana has reached out to around 4000 beneficiaries through 50+ workshops and talks. 3.Empowerment Skill Development C entres : Chetana realizes the importance and an indispensable need of skill development in a personÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s life in order to help them lead a life of respect and self-reliance. Therefore, we organise tailoring/knitting training program to enhance the quality of life of women and teenage girls through enhancement of their skills and knowledge.More than 30 women been empowered at Mohan Garden(Uttam Nagar),22 women in Baljeet Nagar and 40 teenage girls and women in Naraina Industrial Area. 4.Health Behijhak Baatein : With the objective to spread awareness about Menstrual Health and Hygiene in government schools and slums, Chetana started conducting workshops. These workshops have been conducted in over 50 schools of Delhi/NCR and have reached 2500+ beneficiaries. Health Camps : Chetana organises health camps in schools, residential apartments and slums for all focusing women and children. These services comprise of eye check-ups, dental check-ups, and general health check-ups. Around 25 camps have been organized in different places of Delhi and benefitted 1200+ people. 5.Awareness Gender Sensitization : The main idea on which Chetana works is Gender Sensitization. Therefore, to understand what gender is and what are the general generalizations that affect us, Chetana is trying to spread awareness by conducting workshops in schools and colleges among children at grassroots level and youth for a gender bias free society. Legal Awareness : Counseling Centre: Marital Counseling- Chetana also guidance and support to women suffering from discords in their marital and family life, including pre marital issues, cases of domestic violence, dowry, and other exploitations which these women and their families face.

title: CYCLING FEDERATION OF INDIA
detailsOfAchievement: Major Achievements When the Federation was accorded the recognition in 2012 after suspension of 02 years, the Federation impressed upon the Sports Authority of India to open the state of Art the IG Cycling Velodrome, which was lying idle after the commonwealth Games. The World Class velodrome, which is legacy of Commonwealth Games, was made operational by the Federation and put to use on a regular basis and thus the new era of competitive cycling emerges on the Indian Cycling Scene. 1. SAINCA: The Federation in a joint venture with SAI and under an MOU established the Cycling Academy under the name and style of SAI National Cycling Academy, which was inaugurated on 05.03.2014. The aim and object being to train the cyclists from the age group of 14th to 16th year with latest training methods and groom them to International level and with the vision of prepare and get them qualify for 2020 Olympics. The Federation inducted the cyclists at the age group of 14th to 16th year from across the Country by holding trails on the same day and with common entrance test at 18 centres. The trails were conducted jointly with the representative of SAI and state cycling Associations and the results were put on the website on the same day with the points secured by each candidates. With complete transparency and subsequently inducted 50 cyclists after due medical examination and free boarding and lodging were provided and the Federation made special arrangements for their education. They are being trained with latest scientific methods with providing adequate gymnasium facilities have a workshop and with all support staff of physiotherapist, masseur, mental trainer dietician etc. A battery of experienced coaches under the guidance and supervision of Sh. Amar Singh, Arjuna Awardee and Sh. R K Sharma, International qualified coach from World Cycling Centre, Aigle, Switzerland and imparting training to these cyclists. 2. World Cycling Centre: To improve and train the Indian Cyclists up to the International level the Federation has opened a Satellite Centre of the World Cycling Centre, Aigle, Switzerland operated by International Cycling Union (UCI) at Cycling Velodrome, New Delhi. The WCC is providing coaching course at this centre to improve the standard of cycling and to provide equipment in term of cycles and scientific backing in shape of Watt Bikes, which is the latest scientific training machine for the cycling. With the results of these facilities, the Indian Cycling scene has been extremely transformed and has shown tremendous improvement in terms of timings and medals at the Various International level events. To sum up the Indian cyclists, who were ranked at 149th out of 185 Countries in 2013 has shown great improvement has resulted in the ranking at the World level. In the latest World ranking of the UCI, our junior team sprint team in Men junior division is ranked at No. 1, whereas Ms. Deborah a cyclist in the Senior Women Section has attain the 4th Rank in the Time Trial event. The team has resulted in qualification for the World Cup for the first time in the history of the Cycling in the Country, which means are well on track for the qualification of 2020 Olympics, which was the aim of the Federation.

In 2010 we celebrated our Umang 2010 at L.T.G Auditorium.We celebrated our Umang 2011 at Mahila Vidhyalaya Auditorium, Lucknow.
